title: Extra trams for special events
articleContent:
We’re running extra trams for the events below events during January and February. While trams run to their normal frequency, times may differ due to traffic congestion around event venues. Please allow extra time for your journey.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Melbourne Olympic Park

Extra trams are running for the below events:

  • Thursday 30 January to Sunday 2 February – Cricket, Test Match – Australia v England
  • Saturday 1 February – Basketball NBL, Rd 19: Melbourne United v Tasmanian Jackjumpers
  • Sunday 2 February – Basketball NBL, Rd 19: SE Melbourne Phoenix v Adelaide 36ers
  • Saturday 8 February – Basketball, NBL Rd 20: Melbourne United v Melbourne Phoenix
  • Tuesday 11 February – Concert, Aurora: What Happened to the Earth Part 4
  • Sunday 16 February – Concert, XG 1st World Tour: The First Howl
  • Tuesday 25 and Wednesday 26 February – Concert, Khruanhgnin A La Sala 2025
  • Saturday 8 March - Concert, Roxette 2025

Extra tram services run as Route 70a and Route 75a between Flinders Street Station and Stop 7B Rod Laver Arena/MCG Gates 1-3 or Stop 7D Olympic Boulevard

Extra trams running to the above events will be accessible low-floor trams, depending on availability.

Marvel stadium

Extra trains and trams are running for the below events:

  • Friday 7 and Saturday 8 February – Concert, Luke Combs: Australia & NZ Tour
  • Saturday 1 March – Concert, Green Day: The Saviours Tour Australia 2025

Extra tram services run as Route 86a and 30a between Footscray Rd and Stop 10 Parliament Station, via La Trobe St (clockwise, pre-event) or Bourke St (anti-clockwise, post-event)

Extra trams running to the above events will be accessible low-floor trams, depending on availability.

AAMI Park

Extra trains and trams are running for the below events:

  • Friday 24 January – A League Women's Ninja Series - Melbourne Victory v Sydney FC
  • Tuesday 14 February – A League Rd 19: Melbourne Victory v Wellington Phoenix
  • Saturday 15 February – A League Rd 19: Melbourne City v Perth Glory
  • Saturday 22 February – A League Rd 20: Melbourne Victory v Melbourne City

Extra tram services run as Route 70a between Flinders Street Station and Stop 7B Rod Laver Arena/MCG Gates 1-3 or Stop 7D Olympic Boulevard.

Extra trams running to the above events will be accessible low-floor trams, depending on availability.

Rod Laver Arena/Margaret Court Arena

Extra trams are running for the below events:

  • Tuesday 7 January to Sunday 26 January – Tennis, Australian Open 2025
  • Thursday 6 and Saturday 15 February – Concert, Bryan Adams: So Happy It Hurts Tour
  • Sunday 9 to Thursday 13 February – Concert, Drake: The Anita Max Win Tour
  • Friday 14 February – Concert, Keshi: Requiem World Tour
  • Tuesday 18 February – Concert, The Prodigy Disruption Tour
  • Thursday 20 to Saturday 22 February – Concert, Kylie Minogue: Tensions Tour
  • Tuesday 25 and Wednesday 26 February – Concert, Chris Stapleton's All American Road Show
  • Tuesday 28 February - Concert, AP Dhillon: The Brown Print Australian Tour 2025
  • Tuesday 4 to Wednesday 5 and Friday 7 to Saturday 8 March - Concert, Billie Eilish: Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour

Extra tram services run as Route 70a between Flinders Street Station and Stop 7B Rod Laver Arena/MCG Gates 1-3 or Stop 7D Olympic Boulevard.

Extra trams running to the above events will be accessible low-floor trams, depending on availability.

Flemington Racecourse / Melbourne Showgrounds

Extra trains and trams are running for the below events:

  • Friday 14 February – Races, Black Caviar Lightening Race Day
  • Friday 21 to Sunday 23 February – Show, Victorian Caravan & Camping Supershow
  • Friday 28 February – Concert, Knotfest Music Festival

Extra tram services run as Route 57a between Flinders Street Station and Stop 32 Sandown Road.

Extra trams running to the above events will be accessible low-floor trams, depending on availability.
